summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The indictment details her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of multiple minor girls between approximately 1994 and 1997, and her subsequent false statements under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with multiple federal crimes for her role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the sexual abuse of minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein between 1994 and 1997, and for committing perjury in a 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary perpetrator of sexual abuse against minor girls, with Maxwell assisting him. His sexual preference for underage girls and specific abusive acts are detailed.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Described as having a personal and professional relationship; intimate partners and closest associates who conspired to entice and transport minors for sexual abuse.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties.
Maxwell met, groomed, and participated in the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1, who was approximately 14 years old.
Maxwell interacted with and groomed Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico, including providing an unsolicited topless massage.
Maxwell groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged massages knowing they would lead to sexual abuse.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-1 in New York and Florida, with Maxwell's facilitation.
Epstein invited Minor Victim-2 to New Mexico for the purpose of grooming and abuse.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-3 on multiple occasions, including during massages arranged by Maxwell.

events.title: Conspiracy and Abuse of Minors
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls, some as young as 14, at various Epstein properties.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused by Epstein at his New York residence.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided an unsolicited topless massage to Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico residence as part of grooming her for abuse.

events.title: Grooming and Abuse of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged massages knowing they would lead to sexual abuse.

events.title: Maxwell's First Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls and denied interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell gave multiple false statements, including denying awareness of sex toys at Epstein's home, denying knowledge of Epstein's other sexual activities, and denying ever giving anyone a massage.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation, and perjury related to the sexual abuse of minors by Jeffrey Epstein.
The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of at least three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) between 1994 and 1997.

Maxwell is accused of committing perjury during a 2016 civil deposition by denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, his use of sex toys, his other sexual partners, and her own involvement in giving massages.
The abuse and grooming occurred at multiple Epstein properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's London residence.
The indictment states Maxwell and Epstein had an intimate relationship and she was paid by him to manage his properties.
